comment: I absolutely suck at physics, but I took calc-based 1 and 2 with Dr. Yao, and I made A's in both. She is so sweet and helpful. Her lectures are really calculus heavy, but she gives you a formula sheet you can make notes on for each exam + 10 pages of notes for the final. Her optional final project can bump you a whole letter. TAKE YAO!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took her for 2211L before as well. She gives a small lecture before each lab and will answer all of your questions. It's pretty easy to get an A as long as you follow the instructions in the lab manual and show all of your work.

She was overall a very good professor. She explains content fairly well and her breakouts are helpful. She offers an extra credit project at the end of the semester, so take advantage. I didn't and it was the difference between an A and B, but that was on me lol.

She was very surface on the material in class and the homework was harder. BUT, she was very accessible and great at teaching the material in breakouts or individual. Tests are based a lot on the homework and in class problems. Do not slack off and you will be fine. Occasionally a problem is submitted for lecture as attendance but it was sporadic.

She is a very good lab teacher. She spends about the first 15 to 30 minutes explaining each part of the lab and writing down the formulas for each part. After that, most labs take about 20-30 minutes. She is very clear on her grading criteria, and as long as you show work on your lab report, you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: She is an alright professor. She spends too much time on how to derive formulas instead of how and when to apply them. She is a very lenient grader though and her test is fairly straightforward with most questions being a variation of homework questions. She has an in-class assignment, quiz, and homework per week and offers test corrections.
Goated Professor. Provides a ton of extra credit for tests and final exam. Just participate in class to receive it.
Goated prof. Best prof. for physics on this campus other than Hunley, but he's leaving this semester. Don't take anyone else or gg

Honestly I took her for lab and she's awesome. She's not  tough grader, just show your work and use correct sig figs. She lets you drop the lowest lab too. THIS IS THE EASY CLASS I EVER TOOK AND IM A BIO MAJOR!!!! Labs are the only things graded which scared me but I swear you'll be fine. She's also very helpful during the lab.

She has spent more lectures than I can count proving formulas and nothing else. I walk out not knowing how to solve the most basic version of the question that formula is supposed to help solve. The breakout session is rarely helpful because it is focused on the hardest quesiton possible for one topic, most students barely stumbled through it.
Professor Yao is a great instructor. Her class is easy; she gives a small lecture before the lab and answers every question. She also drops your lowest lab and offers a high grade.

She's a really nice lady but I really had a hard time understanding her accent during lectures. If you struggle with accents, you will end up teaching yourself this course. I had to drop and retake. Heed this warning.

Terrible lectures,no study guides or exam practice,hw is difficult to practice with.The lectures consist of explaining theories about concepts rather than giving formulas and explaining how to apply them to do the work.  multiple lectures was her writing out ENTIRE proofs for formulas wasting everyone's time. I learned more from youtube than her.

She does have an accent which may be hard for those that aren't used to it, but she is very knowledgable and if you ask for help she will help. There is weekly homework that is only a couple hard questions, but if you are able to do them then the tests should be easy for you. She also gives a cheatsheet every test.

I took this class at 9 am but she was monotone in the lecture and not very engaging. Luckily I took AP Physics in high school because some sections of this class were confusing. She makes sure you understand what will be important for tests. Overall, a good professor for Physics 1.

The way her grading rubric is set up makes it really hard to fail the class she also offers extra credit towards the final grade just make sure you get at least somewhat half way decent grades on the test and you'll be straight
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Initially going into this class, I had very little experience with Physics. This professor defiently helped me gain more knowlege about the subject but it was very easy to get lost in all of it. Not only is there a large amount of work to do but the exams were difficult compared to the homework she gives. If you really study for the class, its easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment:
Disclaimer: This was a summer class

Dr. Yao understands the material pretty well and the lectures notes are well organized. She even gives demonstrations of the topics we go over. However, she has a clear accent which can make it hard to follow along sometimes, and apparently the summer and fall classes are organized differently.

Has hw and a quiz every week. Quiz is online and is open note/book. Her lectures are alright but the grading criteria for the tests are what got me. Test is half multiple choice and half written problem. The tests literally come down to you either know it or you don't and missing 2 or 3 multiple choice tanks your grade. Just choose someone else.

Do Not take her unless you have no other options. She understands the subject but is not able to properly explain and simplify the material due to English being her second language. Her homework can be difficult because she does not teach how to do some of the problems. Her tests are easy if you understand the concepts and practice her problems.

Yao Yao is a great professor! Her lectures are engaging and full of interactive content. I had a tough schedule this semester so I probably didn't give this class enough attention/study time, thus the C grade, but I was very happy with Yao Yao and would definitely take her again in the future!

Professor Yao is honestly a sweet professor and lets a lot slide in regard to grading. There was homework every week. I had her for lab and lecture and she was amazing. I absolutely loved Yao because she was funny and understanding. She also drops your lowest exam grade. I promise I just suck at physics, so don't look at my grade and worry!

Dr. Yao was extremely easy to follow inside her lectures. Although I passes honors and AP physics in high school, this class just felt like a repeat so I barely learned anything. I never had to study and even for the few topics I didn't learn previously, she explained them thoroughly. I received an A and I didn't even try.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Overall she is a great person. She is very caring for her students and she gives partial credit and curves the exams. Although she does have an accent so understanding her during lectures can be difficult. However, I do recommend her class. She also does extra credit in the final.

Honestly the greatest physics professor a student could have. Her lectures resonated well with her tests and quizzes, she was accessible outside class and was always willing to help students that did not understand topics in the course. Her lectures made me more interested in physics compared to other physics courses I took.

Her class is not hard at all. You could tell the questions on the test is easy, but its one of those iykyk situations. Imagine someone ask you who is the first US president. Its not a hard question at all, but if u dont k, then u dont. She drops lowest test, quiz, HW grade. Tests are curved and bonus points worth 2.5% of entire grade is offered.

Professor Yao was the best physics lab professor to have. She literally gives you the formulas to use and all you really had to do was the math. The lowest lab grade I got was a 93 due to not showing my work. She gives great feedback on each lab and it really isn't that hard to get an A.

SO great! She actually wants you to understand the content. She has a slight accent that she's aware of, but I enjoyed the class despite hating physics. Lectures are interesting yet straightforward. attend lecture since she'll repeat answers for the quizzes, but you should be fine if you choose not to. She's super understanding and sweet
Clear grading, really understanding is one of those rare professors that really cares for her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: She is one of the easiest professors I've had. I have not gotten below a 98% for a lab, and she is very kind and understanding. You cannot get a better physics lab professor than this.

While she did not require you to show up to class, it was the only way of making sure you were doing the right thing in class. We had 3 test that had questions she had never been over. The test consisted of 8 multi-choice, 2 written response, and 3 calculations. She is not very good at explaining things when you show up to her lectures either.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is always accessible, very helpful, and straightforward in lectures. She never explains things in a way that is confusing, but she does teach very deep physics stuff. Be prepared for unfamiliar concepts, weekly homework, and a mandatory recitation. She does not want you to fail!! Please take all the help you can get from her!!

This is possibly the worst class I have ever taken, and it is because the professor has no idea how to teach. She struggles to explain concepts clearly and her videos are not representative of what you will be tested on. Avoid at all costs.
